companyDescription.text:
Bombardier est un leader mondial en aviation axé sur la conception et la fabrication d’avions d’affaires exceptionnels et sur la prestation de services connexes. Les avions des gammes Challenger et Global de Bombardier sont reconnus pour les innovations de pointe qu’ils offrent, la conception de leur cabine, leurs performances et leur fiabilité. La flotte mondiale d’avions Bombardier compte environ 5 000 avions en service auprès d’un large éventail de multinationales, de fournisseurs de vols nolisés et de programmes de multipropriété, ainsi que de gouvernements et de particuliers. Les avions Bombardier sont aussi utilisés dans le monde entier dans le cadre de missions spéciales.

Bombardier, dont le siège social est à Montréal, au Québec, exploite des installations d’activités liées aux aérostructures, d’assemblage ou de finition d’avions au Canada, aux États-Unis et au Mexique. Le solide réseau de soutien à la clientèle de l’entreprise comprend des centres de service situés stratégiquement aux États-Unis et au Canada, ainsi qu’au Royaume-Uni, en Allemagne, en France, en Suisse, en Italie, en Autriche, aux Émirats arabes unis, à Singapour, et en Chine, et en Australie.

On trouvera des nouvelles et des renseignements sur l’entreprise, y compris le rapport sur les aspects environnementaux, sociaux et de gouvernance de Bombardier sur le site bombardier.com. Pour en savoir plus sur les produits de Bombardier et son réseau de service clientèle à l’avant-garde de l’industrie, consultez le site businessaircraft.bombardier.com/fr. Suivez-nous sur Twitter @Bombardier.

description.text:
BOMBARDIER 

Bombardier est un leader mondial dans la création, l’innovation et des changements d’envergures d’avions. Nos produits et services offrent des expériences de transport de classe mondiale qui établissent de nouvelles normes en matière de confort des passagers, d'efficacité énergétique, de fiabilité et de sécurité. Nous sommes une organisation mondiale axée sur la collaboration et l'esprit d'équipe.

Dans Votre Rôle, Vous Devrez
 Analyser les besoins des clients internes et produire les plans de projet appropriés.  Extraire, importer, traiter et documenter les données sources.  Implémenter de jeux des données pour les visibilités Power BI  Être responsable de la conception, de l'implantation et de la documentation de nouvelles applications web.  Supporter et améliorer des systèmes informatiques existants (applications web et desktop).  Assurer le leadership dans l'élaboration des nouveaux outils jusqu’à leur mise en service.  Collaborer activement aux activités et initiatives d'amélioration continue de l’équipe. 
Emploi

Ingénieur méthode

Emplacement principal

CA-QC-Montréal St. Laurent

Organisation

Aéronautique

Horaire

Temps plein

Statut de l'employé

Permanent

Offre d'emploi publiée le

6 juil. 2023, 11:18:17

Date de retrait

Continu

En tant que candidat idéal,  Vous possédez un Baccalauréat en informatique ou en génie logiciel ou toute autre expérience pertinente connexe  Vous avez acquis un minimum de trois (3) années d'expérience  Vous avez une très bonne connaissance dans plusieurs des domaines suivants : Transact-SQL  SQL Server (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)  BI – datawarehouse, PowerBI  Microsoft Azure  ASP.NET (C#)  Modélisation de bases de données  Vous avez des habiletés pour bâtir des partenariats avec les joueurs clés de différents départements  Vous êtes organisé, vous respectez des bonnes pratiques et vous rencontrez les livrables  Vous êtes autonome, votre capacité de travail d'équipe est reconnue  Votre flexibilité vous permet de travailler sur plusieurs tâches / projets à la fois  Vous êtes bilingues (français et anglais) 
L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.

Puisque Bombardier est une entreprise œuvrant à l’échelle mondiale, la connaissance de l’anglais pourrait être requise en raison de la nature de vos fonctions et de la nécessité de communiquer avec des collègues, clients, fournisseurs et/ou partenaires anglophones

Bombardier Aéronautique souscrit au principe d'équité en matière d’emploi et encourage les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à soumettre leurs candidatures.

Que votre candidature soit retenue pour la prochaine étape du processus d’embauche ou non, nous vous tiendrons informé par courriel ou par téléphone. Joignez-vous à nous sur carrières.bombardier.com

 Vos idées mènent le monde.

companyDescription.text:
We create innovative ways to move – on snow, on water, on asphalt or dirt – even in the air.

Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, BRP has been reimagining the way you access your world since 2003 and beyond. Building on a tradition of ingenuity and intense customer focus that go all the way back to 1937, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Austria and Australia. We have a total workforce of more than 14,500 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products comprises Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex boats and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts and recreational aircraft. We support our product lines with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business, to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

Follow us /// Suivez-nous:
Facebook: @brpinfo
Twitter: @BRPnews /// @BRPnouvelles 
YouTube: CommunicationsBRP

description.text:
We are looking for a Data Analyst who will report to the Manager of North America Vehicle Distribution team, and who’ll be tasked with supporting the manager with deploying analyzing business requirements and ensure data tables are accurate and SOX compliant. You will also be responsible of participating and analyzing new vehicle distribution strategy and ensure the data is available for these strategies. As part of your role, you’ll be comfortable with numbers, analysis and continuously looking to improve our data collection methods and analytic practices.
BECOME PART OF OUR TEAM
Here at BRP, we’re creating new ways to get people moving forward, where their experiences are measured by emotion rather than distance. All around the world, our products, achievements, and aspirations reflect our teams’ unique expertise. Want to bring your true self on this adventure?
You’ll Have The Opportunity To
Prepare Data tables to load in our new SAP S4 system.Develop reports that will summarize data requirements for the end users.Document all data requirements for all new transportation strategies and ensure compliance.Participate in business and executive meetings to gather requirements and make recommendations around reporting, data entry and data quality.Extract data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.Filter and clean data by reviewing current data tables and ensure that standards are met.Work with superior to find new processes where data can be optimized.
YOU’LL THRIVE IN THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES: 
Bachelor’s degree in Systems Management and Information Systems or any related field 1+/- years business and data analyst experienceExperience identifying trends and developing a story to connect the dotsWorking Knowledge of Power BI, SQL and data warehouse concepts and terminologySolid in Excel and PowerPointStrong interpersonal and communication skillsAttention to detail and ability to effectively multitask in a deadline-driven atmosphereAbility to clearly and effectively articulate thoughts and points in presentation slides Fluent in French and English verbal and writtenDo you have other qualifications? Tell us what is unique about you that is a great addition to the team.
This position will be based in Sherbrooke, Quebec. Hybrid working conditions also available.
Does this sound like you? We look forward to receiving your application.
AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.
Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:
Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams.Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products. Pension plan: we want to make sure you’ll enjoy retirement; we’ve got you covered. Collective saving opportunities: being part of BRP allows you to tap into the strength of our saving programs. Industry leading healthcare fully paid by BRP, this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters.
What About Some Feel Good Extras
Flexible work schedule: balance is key to innovation, and we want to make sure you are at the top of your game with a schedule that will work for you. Summer schedule: time flies at BRP, so we hit pause to enjoy it.Holiday season shutdown: between Christmas and New Year’s, we close our facilities and refill on good times.Educational resources: you love what you do, and we get you resources to stay cutting-edge, so we all win together.Discount on BRP products: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.
WELCOME TO BRP
We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia, and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination: It’s about the journey.

companyDescription.text:
At Jerry, we’re building a car ownership super app that puts comparison shopping, financing, driving, maintenance and parking solutions at your fingertips and savings in your wallet.

We believe drivers deserve better. Why can’t shopping for insurance, financing and maintaining your vehicle be a click, a swipe or a text away? It should be. We’re making that happen. 

Our custom artificial intelligence, machine learning and bots allow us to provide the best, personalized service for all car ownership needs. The Jerry team’s focus on customer experience results in exceptional transaction speed. With our first product, Jerry redesigned and disrupted the century-old car insurance process, turning stacks of pages and hours of calls into a handful of clicks. That’s why we’re the only car insurance marketplace that gives you the best, customized quotes from more than 55 name-brand insurance carriers in 45 seconds. Jerry helps drivers shop for the best price, compare against current coverage, purchase without a single phone call (unless you want one!) and maintain the best policy for your needs. 

Led by serial entrepreneurs, tech elite alumni, and fintech, insurtech and auto experts, Jerry attracts people driven to create a customer experience that makes people happy by saving them money and time. And it’s working. Jerry is the #1 rated and most downloaded app in the category. 

With headquarters in the heart of Silicon Valley, offices in Toronto and Buffalo, and remote team members in four countries, Jerry has removed physical location from recruiting restraints to capture top talent. Join us.

Awards:
-One of only 50 U.S. startups to be named a LinkedIn Top Startup 2021.
-Featured as one of 150 fastest-growing companies to accelerate your career by Otta in 2021.
-Included in Forbes and Statista America’s Best Startup Employers 2022.
-Ranked on Y-Combinator Top Companies List 2022.
-Art Agrawal Named on of The Top 25 InsurTech CEOs 2022.

description.text:
We'd love to hear from you if you like:
Making a big impact with a Forbes Top Startup EmployerWorking on products that have traction (40X revenue growth in 4 years | #1 rated app in the insurance comparison category)Solving problems in a huge market ($2T market size)Working closely with serial entrepreneurs and seasoned leaders who have scaled companies like Robinhood, Amazon, LinkedIn, Wayfair, SoFi, Microsoft, etc. 

About the opportunity:

We are looking for a data scientist to join our team! Helping everyday, hard working Americans save time and money on their cars and creating a world class experience is what drives every decision we make as a company. Since launching our mobile app in 2019, we have amassed over 4M customers, expanded our product offerings to multiple categories and scaled our team 10X. Our data team fuels all of our business and product decisions through delivering analytical insights and building advanced models.

Reporting to our VP of Business Operations and Analytics, you will leverage data to drive growth and retention for our core insurance product. You will perform analytical deep dives, develop and analyze experiments, build analytical models, and make recommendations that inform our product roadmaps. Working with a brilliant team of product managers, software engineers, data scientists and business leaders, you will play a big role in accelerating our growth and taking our customer experience to the next level.

Responsibilities:
Lead the design and development of A/B tests on app features and user experienceDefine data science standards and best practices and drive operational excellencePartner with product managers to advise product decisionsPartner with and mentor data analysts to build reports and visualizationPartner with other data scientists to evolve, optimize and integrate machine learning modelsProduce research projects to recommend business strategies

What we're looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or a related quantitative discipline3 years of experience as a data scientist in consumer-facing web or mobile app environmentExperience designing and implementing A/B tests, and analyzing user experienceHands-on experience with (and advanced proficiency in) SQLHands-on experience with ETL and data warehousesWorking knowledge of Python or RExperience with analytical and visualization platforms (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, etc.) 

Jerry is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy, reproductive health decisions or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other characteristics protected by applicable local, state or federal laws. 

Jerry is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@getjerry.com

About Jerry:

Jerry is building the first Super App to save car owners time and money on all their car expenses. Drivers deserve better. That’s why we’re committed to making shopping for insurance, financing, maintenance, repairs, parking and more just a few clicks, texts, or swipes away.

Jerry is taking processes that haven’t substantively changed in decades and reimagining and redesigning them. Using artificial intelligence, machine learning and bots, Jerry eliminates the need for long forms and phone calls while providing personalized services for all car-owners’ needs.

Today, Jerry is the #1 rated and most downloaded app in its category and the fastest way to compare and buy car insurance. We have more than 2M customers and we are just getting started. Join our team of curious and passionate people who love tackling real-world problems and be a part of building a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.

Jerry was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $130 million in financing.

description.text:
Come Work with Us!
At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.
Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Manager, Reporting, Automation & Analyst
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
RBC is currently recruiting for the exciting role of Manager, Reporting & Analytics. In this role, you will work directly with product / client partners in Client Profile Segment Team, especially the Newcomer & Cultural Client teams, to fulfill the following critical roles:
Support information-based business decisions by identifying, understanding, capturing, organizing, presenting, and disseminating data trends.Work with business partners to grow profitable relationships with our clients and create sustainable value for RBC shareholders.
What will you do?
Participate in strategy meetings to provide input, gather and document business requirements, and help formulate analytical framework.Influence the approach to answering business questions with deep RBC product insights.Seek out new ways to engineer and manufacture best-in-class standard reports to showcase insights and support tactics.Increase the standardization and efficiency of regular reporting.Manage day-to-day workflow and negotiate realistic timelines.Participate actively in self and peer development relating to financial products, operational processes, relationship management, and technology enhancement.Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to.
Must-have: 
3 years of hands on experience with large relational databases and working experience with multiple querying tools such as native SQL, SAS, BI/QueryProven technical experience with Tableau (desktop and server), UNIX and Windows integrated environments.Be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environments.Strong, innate, business and data acumen.Applied data validation mechanisms.Ability to thrive when working under pressureUndergraduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or other quantitative discipline.
Nice-to-have:
Knowledge of Teradata or DB2 is definite asset.Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment.Experience with developing reports using OLAP tools.Experience with financial products and services and their corresponding data.
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensationOpportunity to learn and apply new businesses, techniques, and ideas.Ability to make a difference and lasting impactWork in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing teamOpportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

description.text:
About BCIBritish Columbia Investment Management Corporation (BCI) is one of the largest asset managers in Canada. With $233.0 billion of managed assets, BCI invests globally on behalf of public sector clients. We do fulfilling and meaningful work that makes a difference: 630,000 pension plan beneficiaries and 2.5 million British Columbian workers depend on our clients’ returns. Ensuring their continued financial security is important to us.
The people who work at BCI are committed, passionate, and approachable. They aim for continuous improvement and share BCI’s core values of clients first, performance focused, world class, accountability, transparency, and integrity.
BCI is focused on building a culture of excellence through our people practices and employee led initiatives. Being named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Top Family-Friendly Employers and BC’s Top Employers is recognition of BCI’s ongoing effort to be a progressive workplace of choice that continues to attract, retain and promote talent professionals. As an active in-house asset manager, BCI depends on the specialized skills and expertise of its people to successfully execute its world-class investment strategies and fulfill client needs.
BCI offers an exceptional opportunity to work at a world-class organization while living in a west coast setting. We are expanding our team and our skill base to equip BCI for the future.
https://reviews.canadastop100.com/top-employer-british-columbia-investment-management
Be part of building and bringing to life BPA (Business Process Automation) and Low Code/Rapid Prototyping tools. We have an underlying framework and now we want you to help bring use cases to life. We are seeking two levels of experience, so if you like to build, then this is the opportunity for you!
Please Note: This position can be in Victoria or Vancouver, BC. We will provide relocation assistance to the successful candidate.
An overview of what you’ll do:The Software Automation Engineer is responsible for automation products and projects. In addition to designing, developing, and testing automation workflows, the Software Automation Engineer will engage stakeholders to exhibit the “Art of the Possible”, identify process improvements and automation opportunities, and create the solutions that fulfill these opportunities. Collaborate with business and technology teams to define and deliver projects and will support deployments and troubleshoot production issues, with potential to participate in an on-call rotation in support of business-critical processes.
Who you’ll work alongside:The position reports to the Manager, Integration and Automation Services. You will be working alongside a group of highly skilled Platform and Automation Engineers who are passionate about technology and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. You will also collaborate with other technology and business stakeholders as part of a wide-ranging list of initiatives and projects.
The location and levels:The position can be based in either Vancouver or Victoria with travel between the two cities and has two career progression levels.Level 1: Responsible for software automation engineering operations and projects with a low-to-mid level of complexity, works under guidance, has 3+ years of experience, and applies key concepts effectively.Level 2: Responsible for software automation engineering operations and projects with a mid-to-high level of complexity, has 5+ years of experience, and works with full competence in the role.
What we’d love you to bring to the table:The following qualifications are illustrative of a standard Level 2 and may be scaled down in scope based upon the level selected.Bachelor’s degree in Technology, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related fieldUp to 5+ years of experience as a Developer or Automation Engineer with hands on experience in Intelligent Business Process Management Systems (iBPMS) tools and rapid development platforms such as UiPath, Power Apps, Power Automate, and AppianA minimum of 3 years’ experience with Agile methods (Scrum and/or Kanban) and DevOps practicesMust have experience with issue tracking and product development and version control toolsEnjoys working with internal clients using listening, communication, and problem-solving skillsAbility to present technical details to non-technical audiencesAbility to work through ambiguous situationsAbility to multitask in a fast-paced environment and prioritize the most critical tasks and projectsUnderstanding of workflow-based logic, process modelling, and process analysis
Nice to have, but not necessary:Knowledge of the investment management/financial services industry
The details of what you’ll do:The following responsibilities are illustrative of a standard Level 2 and may be scaled down or up in complexity and autonomy based upon the level selected.Develops and ratifies detailed architecture for complex solutions in collaboration with clients and project teams, including external design (navigation, screens, reports, UI) and internal design (software and hardware platform, connectivity, modules, back-end and front-end components, interfaces) based on established architectural standardsDesigns and develops automated and optimized client solutions using the BCI automation toolkit (PowerApps, Power Automate (Flow), Appian, UiPath)Collaborates with business and technical teams to define business and non-functional requirements, create compelling user stories and produce detailed solution designsContinually improves automation platforms, makes recommendations for changes, and contributes to automation platform administration, road mapping, and enhancementsAssesses new automation technologies through state-of-the-art reviews or proofs of concept and contributes to application roadmap development and business casesDevelops test strategies, designs automation frameworks and writes unit/functional tests to drive delivery of high quality and industry-standard products that deliver maximum business value to customersPresents products to internal and external stakeholders, educates and guides others and provides feedback in an open, respectful and constructive mannerApplies and shares knowledge of DevOps practices including continuous deployment, continuous integration, test-driven development and automated testingProactively identifies risks and issues and proposes solutions to remove barriersEnsures technical artifacts are accurate, accessible, maintained and communicatedPerforms other related duties as required
Focus areas:For both levels, additional expertise or experience is required in one or more of the following focus areas.
A) Robotics Process AutomationActs as a subject mater expert in the area of Robotic Process Automation using the UiPath platformSignificant experience creating bots to automate optimized business processesAbility to discern and provide guidance to business and technology members on the scenarios where RPA is appropriateDeploy RPA components including bots, robots, development tools, code repositories and logging tools and work with release engineersExperience developing and consuming APIsAdvising on cost-effective usage of the UiPath platform
B) Low Code Development / Rapid PrototypingActs as a subject mater expert in the areas of Low Code Development and Rapid Prototyping using the Microsoft Power Platform. Special emphasis on Power Apps and Power Automate (flows)Significant experience implementing automations in the Microsoft ecosystem (Windows, Office 365, Azure)Capable of creating compelling, intuitive user interfacesPossesses deep understanding of the architecture and connectivity required to make data sources accessible to Power Platform tools both on-premise, in the Azure cloud and within Office 365
Why apply to join BCI:With our values as our anchor, it’s our people that help shape employee-focused initiatives and who create the environment we work in each day – all of which further strengthens our culture. BCI has been recognized as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers – for the fourth consecutive year - and has built programs and benefits to support all our employees, including; Extended health and dental coverage, start on your first day of work. We have you covered! Eligibility to the defined benefit BC Public Service Pension Plan providing you with a secure retirement income. Time off includes: 20 days vacation, 6 paid sick days, 6 paid personal days, and 2 paid days for volunteering – to support physical, mental, and community health. A hybrid schedule offering you the flexibility to work from home up to two days a week. Annual wellness allowance to support an active lifestyle well as physical well-being when working at home. On-going learning through our in-house mentoring program, professional dues support, tuition reimbursement, and online and in-house learning. As a pilot program in 2023, we are offering ‘work from anywhere in the world for up to 1-month’. Our telehealth provider Dialogue connects you and your family to virtual healthcare appointments. 
At BCI, we value diversity and believe in fostering an inclusive culture where all employees can be successful. We are performance and client focused and value integrity; if you share these values, we want to know you. 
We recognize that some skills can be learned on the job and encourage all to apply. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations), contact us at hr@bci.ca. We would like to hear from you!
Closing Date: July 30, 2023
Interested in joining our team and want to learn of other career opportunities with BCI? Create a profile and sign up for job alerts at: https://bci.wd10.myworkdayjobs.com/BCI_Careers

description.text:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About The Team
You will join Team Space Kittens to help drive and build outstanding user experiences for the Journeys product. Workday Journeys enables organizations to build tailored, concierge-style experiences for employees to help guide them through the transitions and critical moments.
We are looking for inquisitive and passionate engineers who proudly contribute clean code and collaborate optimally with various team members. Quality is very important to you and you hold yourself and those around you accountable to deliver fully tested, quality code. We believe that the best user experiences combine engineering excellence, immersive UIs, and secure backend services.
The software you and your team delivers will have an impact on millions of people. Our customers include Amazon, Netflix, Patagonia, Sony, Toyota, and many more phenomenal companies around the world!
About The Role
This is an opportunity to join as a Sr Associate Software Development Engineer working on one of the newer products built within Workday on a team that values engineering excellence and aims to focus on sound architecture, quality and building the right things, the right way. As a newer product we frequently work with our customers, Product Manager, UX and design to determine solutions that will tackle the problems our customers face and find product market fit. Our business logic is built in the backend using Workday’s Xpresso framework with a React front-end that supports End user actions and an editor to create personalized content using HCM core data. We are going to expand into three scrum teams to enhance the Journeys product offering.
As part of Team Space Kitten you will:
Be excited about mentorship and welcome mentorship for yourselfDesign and develop a product in a metadata-driven development environmentCreate and maintain robust, efficient and maintainable code using an OO framework and class modelingContribute to knowledge sharing within the team and wider organizationBe a strong advocate for the development process, engineering best practices, quality and culture of continuous improvementBe in the office at least 50% of the time to collaborate and create lasting relationships with your team and the wider organizationBond with your teammates to build and embody a strong engineering culture
About You
Basic Qualifications
1+ years experience building enterprise-level software with a focus on performance, scalability, and security1+ years of experience with Web application development or SaaS (Software as a Service)1+ years of experience in Object oriented design and development in language such as Java or C# and UML modeling1+ years of experience writing reliable and maintainable unit and system testsA Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
Other Qualifications
Ability to balance multiple priorities and communicate across organizational boundariesStrong written and verbal communications skills, and the ability to work smoothly with both technical and non-technical audiencesExperienced in working and collaborating with diverse teams in a dynamic, rapid growth environment using Scrum successfullyExperience with XML and Integration technologies is a plusExperience in front end UI technologies like React is a plus
Our Approach to Flexible Work
With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

description.text:
Logient is currently looking for an ETL Analyst.

Majors Responsabilities Will Be
ETL: Integrate, debug, and optimize Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes to ensure seamless data integration from various sources into the data warehouse. Identify and implement enhancements to improve ETL efficiency, specifically using SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services)Reports Backend: Create, optimize, and update views and data models to support reporting and analytics requirements. Collaborate with front-end developers to ensure seamless integration between the backend and frontend components. Deployment, CI/CD, Repository Maintenance: Contribute to the deployment process by ensuring proper version control, continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and repository maintenance. Collaborate with DevOps teams to streamline the deployment process. Data Quality: Develop test cases, perform data analysis, and create scripts to ensure and improve data quality within the Data Warehouse. Technical Documentation: Create comprehensive technical documentation, including design specifications, process flows, and user guides.

Strong experience in Data Warehouse architecture, maintenance, and ETL processes. Familiarity with data governance principles and data privacy regulations. Proficiency in designing and optimizing data aggregation techniques. Solid understanding of backend development principles and practices. Expertise in creating, optimizing, and updating views and data models for reporting purposes. Proficient in technical analysis and problem-solving. Experience with deployment processes, CI/CD pipelines, and repository maintenance. 
Technical Skills
 SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) SSMS (SQL Server Management Studio) / DBeaver Advanced SQL Visual Studio Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps) PowerBI Git (CI/CD): Bitbucket, Azure DevOps Other (JIRA, Confluence, Excel, etc)

Morningstar, Inc. is a leading provider of independent investment 
insights in North America, Europe, Australia, and Asia. The 
Company offers an extensive line of products and services for 
individual investors, financial advisors, asset managers and 
owners, retirement plan providers and sponsors, and institutional 
investors in the debt and private capital markets. Morningstar 
provides data and research insights on a wide range of investment 
offerings, including managed investment products, publicly 
listed companies, private capital markets, debt securities, and realtime global market data. Morningstar also offers investment 
management services through its investment advisory subsidiaries, 
with approximately $246 billion in assets under advisement and 
management as of Dec. 31, 2022. The Company operates through 
wholly- or majority-owned subsidiaries in 32 countries.

description.text:
Our Team

Morningstar believes in empowering investors through research, data, design, and technology. Morningstar Direct (https://www.morningstar.com/products/direct) is Morningstar’s flagship software product that helps Asset and Wealth Managers build and manage their portfolios and communicate with their clients. Our team is modernizing the core Direct product using web & desktop technologies, cloud-based infrastructure, and a refreshed product strategy. Our core offering is complemented by a variety of reporting and analytical products including our next generation tool, Analytics Lab (https://www.morningstar.com/products/direct/analytics-lab). We aim to provide a first-class experience in accessing, analyzing, and reporting on Morningstar research and data. We are deeply inquisitive; we do not take “that’s just the way it’s always been done” or “that’s just best practice” as valid answers and instead seek to fine-tune our product development process for maximum impact. We are empowered professionals who are given problems to solve and not tickets to implement. We value team productivity over individual productivity and this culture of “giving” means we enjoy and highly value collaborating with our teammates.

About The Role

We are looking for a C# senior software engineer to work with a team focused on C# development for Linux based applications. Every day, you will work with team members across disciplines in product development (Engineering, QA, Project Management, Product Management, etc.). You’ll interact daily with our product managers to understand our domain and create technical solutions to execute our strategic business and technology initiatives. You will participate in agile ceremonies such as standups, retrospectives, and planning meetings. 

Job Responsibilities
Build well-designed, well-engineered, stable, and scalable products.  Follow software design best practices such as continuous integration, test-driven development, and regular deployments.  Be passionate about quality, process, programming, and investing in general.   Find opportunities for improvement, seize them, and then share your findings with others.  Take ownership of the success of the team with a "gets things done" attitude. Seek understanding of and opportunities to leverage new technologies.  Have or desire to become an AWS certified developer  Help to shape product vision 

Qualifications
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience. Demonstrated experience and strong understanding of computer science fundamentals: data structures, algorithms, design patterns. 5+ years of hands-on experience on .Net platform development Familiar with C#, C# core and .net frameworks Well versed with source code management and other DevOps practices including build & deployment automation Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Experience with Agile methodology and tools like JIRA. Friendly and enjoys working in a collaborative team with excellent spoken and written communication skills. Humble, honest, and to the point. Highly organized and able to remain productive even when you have multiple deliverables. 

Nice to Have
Backend services/ APIs development experience Familiar with Redis, InfrastructureExperience working on databases like MSSQL, Postgres or any other relational database Experience with Amazon Web Services technologies like CloudFront, S3, API gateway, ECS, Elastic Search, and ElastiCache Financial background, especially in portfolio analysis. 

100_MstarResCanad Morningstar Research, Inc. (Canada) Legal Entity

Morningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. We’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, at least three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

companyDescription.text:
Validere is a measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) SaaS company that helps energy organizations transform disconnected, incomplete data into clear and immediately actionable pathways to financial and environmental value.

Over 50 of North America’s leading energy companies rely on Validere’s technology and multidisciplinary experts to understand their physical and environmental commodities and navigate an increasingly complex environment with clarity and ease.

Validere is on a mission to better human prosperity by making the energy supply chain efficient and sustainable. The company has offices in Houston, Calgary, and Toronto.

description.text:
Who we are:
Validere is a measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) SaaS company that helps energy organizations transform disconnected, incomplete data into clear and immediately actionable pathways to financial and environmental value.
Over 50 of North America’s leading energy companies rely on Validere’s technology and multidisciplinary experts to understand their physical and environmental commodities and navigate an increasingly complex environment with clarity and ease.
Validere is on a mission to better human prosperity by making the energy supply chain efficient and sustainable. The company has offices in Houston, Calgary, and Toronto.
Who you are:
We are looking for a Software Developer to join our Calculators Team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in designing, developing, and deploying applications and infrastructure that enable the seamless integration of emissions calculations into our core platform.
Let’s give you a purpose:
Design, develop and deploy the applications and infrastructure which will support the integration of emissions calculations in our core platformEnsure the auditability, observability and repeatability of the calculationsEnsure the integrity of the code base and its integration with the rest of engineering stackHelp create, implement and uphold a robust Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including quality assurance, testing and performance monitoringCollaborate with the product team to align software development efforts with product goals


What you bring to the team:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, data science or equivalent work experienceExperience building production-grade python applicationsExperience deploying applications and infrastructure using cloud services (AWS, GCP, Azure)


Nice to have:
Experience working in a startup environmentExperience with relational databasesExposure to data science, machine learning, statistics or first principles physical modeling


We love it here, you will too:

Our shared values:
Deliver (the highest) valueRemove frictionMake it more scalable everydayBe fair & transparentStay well & safe


Validere is an equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the interview process and beyond. We are committed to providing an inclusive, open, and diverse work environment.

Talentify was formed on the principle that there was an easier, more scalable way to find, assess and select candidates at scale.

We believe there is a simpler way to deliver experiences. That technology can exist to connect and engage talent with talent and in so doing, create more meaningful interactions for those involved.

description.text:
Advantages Of Joining Our Team At Employer
 Opportunity to be part of a large department within the School of Medicine, with a diverse and collaborative team of faculty, fellows, and support staff. Integration of research, education, and patient care, contributing to the overall mission and goals of the department. Significant growth and expansion expected in the coming years, providing opportunities for professional development and advancement. Affiliation with a leading university-affiliated children's health system, recognized for its excellence in research, technology, and clinical care. Work with a wide range of funding agencies and institutions, contributing to the advancement of pediatric healthcare.
Responsibilities Of The Sponsored Research Financial Analyst
 Provide comprehensive financial analysis and fiscal management for multiple divisions within the Department of Pediatrics. Manage pre and post-award administration for sponsored projects, including federal, state, private grants, contracts, and clinical trials. Work with various funding agencies, both domestic and international, ensuring compliance with research administration guidelines. Establish and revise procedures to meet changing needs, develop internal reporting systems, and provide financial planning and recommendations. Collaborate with Division Chiefs and Principal Investigators, coordinating the financial aspects of award administration.
Minimum Qualifications
 Seven years of related experience, education/training, or a Bachelor's degree plus three years of related experience. Thorough understanding of research administration guidelines and compliance requirements. Ability to manage a significant volume of transactions, perform complex financial analysis, and create customized reports. Proficiency in spreadsheet and database software for financial analysis and reporting. Strong organizational and communication skills, with a customer service focus. Knowledge of generally accepted accounting and reporting principles.
Preferred Qualifications
 Experience with UCSD online accounting and personnel systems. Prior research financial experience. Familiarity with UC systems, Oracle, and advanced Excel.
Additional Information
 Employment is subject to a criminal background check. Occasional evenings and weekends may be required. Job offer is contingent on successful engagement in the UC COVID-19 Vaccination program. Life-support certifications must include hands-on practice and in-person skills assessment. UC San Diego Health Sciences is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. UC San Diego is a smoke and tobacco-free environment.

description.text:
Titre du poste: Analyste principal(e) des donnéesLieu: Gatineau (Québec), CanadaÉchelle salariale: 88 618 $ à 101 999 $Exigences linguistiques: BilingueSoumettez votre mise en candidature avant: 13 juillet 2023 - 23 h 59, heure du pacifique
Intention du processusUn bassin de candidats partiellement qualifiés pourrait être établi à partir de ce processus afin de doter des postes identiques ou similaires ayant des exigences linguistiques variées et diverses exigences de sécurité au sein de Services publics et Approvisionnement Canada dans la Région de la capitale nationale.
Qui sommes-nous?Nous sommes Un seul SPAC !Services publics et Approvisionnement Canada (SPAC) aide le gouvernement du Canada à servir la population canadienne. Grâce à des principes fortement axés sur la prestation de services de qualité aux clients, nous fournissons à d’autres ministères, organismes et sociétés d’État des services novateurs dans des domaines comme la gestion des biens immobiliers, les achats, les opérations bancaires, la paye et les pensions et la traduction. En dispensant ces services centralisés aux ministères et organismes, nous leur permettons de concentrer leur énergie sur ce qu’ils font de mieux : la prestation de programmes et de services aux Canadiens.
Pourquoi vous joindre à nous?À SPAC, nous nous engageons à créer une main-d'œuvre compétente et représentative qui reflète la diversité de la population canadienne. Nous travaillons fort pour créer un milieu de travail accueillant, respectueux et inclusif grâce à une variété de programmes et d'initiatives. D’ailleurs, nous avons été nommés l’un des meilleurs employeurs pour la diversité au Canada pour la septième année consécutive et voici une liste de certaines de nos réalisations en matière de diversité et d’inclusion :• cinq réseaux de la diversité;• un Groupe de travail sur l’antiracisme, la culture organisationnelle et l’équité;• l’Unité nationale de la réconciliation et de la mobilisation des Autochtones;• un Bureau de l’ombudsman de la santé mentale (premier en son genre au sein du gouvernement);• un Bureau de l’accessibilité et;• un centre d’expertise sur l’analyse comparative entre les sexes plus (ACS+).
Quelles qualifications avez-vous besoin pour joindre notre équipe?ÉtudesGrade d’un établissement d’enseignement postsecondaire reconnu avec spécialisation acceptable en économie, en sociologie ou en statistique. Remarque : Les candidats doivent obligatoirement avoir un grade. Les cours liés à la spécialisation doivent être acceptables et peuvent avoir été suivis dans un établissement d’enseignement postsecondaire reconnu, mais pas nécessairement dans le cadre d’un programme d’études postsecondaires dans la spécialisation demandée. La spécialisation peut également être obtenue au moyen d’une combinaison acceptable d’études, de formation et/ou d’expérience.
ExpérienceExpérience appréciable* dans au moins un des domaines suivants : gestion des données, analyse des données ou science des données.Expérience de la préparation et de la présentation de documents d’information (tel que des notes d’information, des présentations, des rapports ou autres outils de communication) pour la direction**.Expérience de l’établissement et du maintien de relations avec des partenaires ou des intervenants à l’interne ou de l’extérieur.Expérience à grande échelle*** de la gestion de données, du développement de bases de données et de l’analyse de données à l’aide de logiciels statistiques tels que SCS, STATA, SQL ou R.
Définitions:* On entend par « expérience appréciable » l’expérience acquise pendant au moins trois (3) ans.** On entend par « direction », les directeurs et les titulaires de poste de niveau supérieur.*** On entend par « grande échelle » des enregistrements de données se chiffrant en milliers ou en millions.

CONDITIONS D'EMPLOIAutorisation sécuritaire Secret

companyDescription.text:
Definity Financial Corporation is the parent company to some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative property and casualty insurance brands and companies, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. We focus on making insurance better for our customers, our employees, our broker partners, and our communities.

Our promise to employees is to provide a workplace that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering. Our inclusive environment provides the space to innovate with colleagues and implement even better ways of doing things. We invest in our employees’ growth and development and help them thrive. With our flexible, hybrid work arrangements, total rewards packages, company share ownership program, and emphasis on work-life balance, it’s better here.

If you’re looking for a career where your perspective and expertise are valued, you’ll find it here at Definity.

* * *

La Société financière Definity est la société mère de compagnies d’assurance de dommages parmi les plus établies et innovatrices au Canada, soit Assurance Economical, Sonnet Assurance, Family Insurance Solutions et la Compagnie d’assurance Petline. Definity est dévouée à faire évoluer l’assurance pour sa clientèle, ses équipes, son réseau de courtage et ses communautés.

Nous promettons de fournir un environnement de travail collaboratif, ambitieux, valorisant et stimulant. Notre environnement inclusif vous permet d’innover avec vos collègues et de mettre en œuvre de meilleures façons de travailler. Nous investissons dans la croissance et le perfectionnement de nos gens et les aidons à s’épanouir. Grâce à nos options flexibles de travail hybride, notre programme de rémunération globale, notre régime d’actionnariat et l’accent sur l’équilibre travail-famille, vous évoluerez avec nous. 

Si vous souhaitez une carrière où votre point de vue sera reconnu, ne cherchez pas plus loin que Definity.

description.text:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leaders partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
What can you expect in this role?
Partner with enterprise-wide business teams to understand their business problems and brainstorm meaningful and creative solutions. Design, develop and deliver reports, dashboards, and data insights that provide value to our business partners. Maintain and support existing reports, dashboards and other processes owned by the team. Implement BI leading practices throughout the project lifecycle. Learn and use cutting edge technologies, such as Google BigQuery & Tableau Server.Participate in strategic discussions to enhance your business knowledge and skillsets Gain exposure to all aspects of P&C Insurance.
What do you bring to the role?
University or college degree in Computer Science, Business with Computer Science minor, Actuarial Science, Data Analytics or a related discipline.Professional experience with Tableau is mandatoryPrior experience in a business intelligence role, with P&C insurance industry experience will be an asset.Experience using SQL and/or Google Big Query is preferred“Can-do” attitude to solving business problems.High attention to detail with demonstrated ability to reconcile reportsStrong written communication skills. 
This is a 6 month contract role.
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).

companyDescription.text:
MaintainX is the world-leading mobile-first workflow management platform for industrial and frontline workers. We are a modern IoT-enabled cloud-based tool for maintenance, safety, and operations on equipment and facilities.

MaintainX helps businesses track reactive and preventive maintenance and control their daily operations, such as safety inspections, quality inspections, and operating checklists—all with a digital audit trail

Here's what we digitize and take away from the clipboard:

- Safety Procedures
- Environmental Checklists
- Tooling & Gauge Reporting
- Maintenance Procedures
- Auditing/Inspection Workflows
- Training Checklists

We allow plant managers to become more efficient operators by delivering real-time business insights from the field.

MaintainX is the fastest and first Frontline Resource Management (FRM) system. Learn more at www.getmaintainx.com!

MaintainX is designed to work with organizations of all sizes - whether you are running a small team of 2 or coordinating a massive team of hundreds of folks around multiple locations, we want to empower every organization to streamline their workflows.

description.text:
MaintainX est la première plateforme mobile de gestion des procédures pour les travailleurs de l'industrie et les travailleurs de première ligne. Nous construisons le GitHub pour les procédures de travail réelles telles que la maintenance, la sécurité et les opérations, et nous améliorons l'efficacité opérationnelle de plus de 5,000 entreprises, dont Univar, Quikrete, ABInBev, Duracell, Marriott et McDonald's.

Nous avons levé 54 millions de dollars en capital-risque à la suite d'un récent tour de financement de série B mené par Bessemer Ventures, August Capital, Amity Ventures, Ridge Ventures ainsi que les fondateurs d'UiPath et de Thumbtack.

MaintainX is the world leading mobile-first workflow management platform for industrial and frontline workers. We are a modern IoT enabled cloud based tool for maintenance, safety, and operations on equipment and facilities. MaintainX powers operational excellence for 5,000+ businesses including Univar, Quikrete, ABInBev, Duracell, Marriott and McDonald’s.

We've raised $54 million in venture capital following a recent Series B funding round led by Bessemer Ventures, August Capital, Amity Ventures, Ridge Ventures as well as the founders of UiPath and Thumbtack.

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un ingénieur en chef des données réfléchi et bien équilibré pour rejoindre notre équipe en pleine expansion ! Vous serez responsable de la construction des fondations de notre architecture de données pour alimenter les décisions à l'échelle de l'entreprise chez MaintainX, en plus d'aider à construire des outils que nos clients commerciaux utilisent tous les jours. Vous serez le premier professionnel de l'ingénierie des données à rejoindre une équipe saine et collaborative, améliorant continuellement nos pratiques d'ingénierie et fournissant une technologie innovante, tout en gardant le plaisir.

Votre objectif sera de développer et de maintenir notre plateforme de données pour créer et soutenir les produits de données de MaintainX. Les ingénieurs de données sont les garants de l'intégrité, de la qualité et de l'accessibilité de nos données. Ils s'assurent que notre plateforme recueille des données de haute qualité à partir de toutes les applications en appliquant les meilleures pratiques d'ingénierie logicielle à nos pipelines de données. Les ingénieurs de données permettent aux utilisateurs de données de MaintainX d'accéder à des données exploitables où et quand ils en ont besoin.

We are looking for a thoughtful, well-rounded Lead Data Engineer to join our expanding team! You will be responsible for building the foundations of our data architecture to power company-wide decisions at MaintainX, in addition to helping build tools that our business customers use every day. You will be the first Data Engineering professional to come onboard, joining a healthy and collaborative team, continuously improving our engineering practices and delivering innovative technology, all while keeping it fun.

Your goal will be to develop and maintain our data platform to create and support MaintainX’s data products. Data engineers are the owners of our data integrity, quality and accessibility. They make sure that our platform gathers high quality data from all applications by applying software engineering best-practices to our data pipelines. Data engineers enable MaintainX’s data users to access actionable data where and when they need it.

Responsabilités / Responsibilities
Superviser les pipelines de données à travers plusieurs piliers de l'entreprise (marketing, ventes, produits, opérations, intégrations, etc.)Vous travaillez en partenariat avec le marketing et les ventes pour mettre en œuvre des initiatives clés en matière de données liées à la génération de chiffre d'affaires.Contribuer à notre feuille de route en matière d'ingénierie des données afin de répondre aux besoins croissants de l'entreprise en matière de données et de volume de données.Développer et maintenir notre pipeline analytique, y compris l'extraction et le chargement à partir d'API tierces, et le suivi des événements à partir de nos produits.Prendre en charge nos outils d'automatisation du marketingDiriger et participer à la croissance des futures équipes d'ingénierie des données.Développer de nouveaux produits de données pour nos clients et les parties prenantes internes.Gérer la sécurité des données, la conformité et l'accèsAméliorer les tests et le CI/CD de notre plateforme d'analyseConstruire des outils pour rendre nos ingénieurs analytiques et nos analystes de données plus efficacesServir de mentor aux membres juniors de l'équipe, en leur fournissant des conseils techniques.--------
Oversee data pipelines across several business pillars (Marketing, Sales, Product, Ops, Integrations, etc.)Partner with Marketing and Sales to deliver on key data initiatives tied to revenue generationContribute to our data engineering roadmap to support the company's growing data needs and volume of dataDevelop and maintain our analytics pipeline, including extract and load from third party APIs, and event tracking from our productsSupport our marketing automation toolsLead and participate in the growth of future data engineering teamsDevelop new data products for our clients and internal stakeholdersManage data security, compliance and accessImprove testing and CI/CD of our analytics platformBuild tooling to make our analytics engineers and data analysts more efficientServe as a mentor of junior team members, providing technical guidanceExigences / Requirements:
Plus de 5 ans d'expérience en tant qu'ingénieur en données ou l'équivalent en tant qu'ingénieur logicielExpérience du mentorat technique, du coaching et de l'amélioration des résultats techniques des personnes qui vous entourent.Des compétences exceptionnelles en communication et la capacité de traduire des concepts techniques dans un langage facile à comprendre pour nos parties prenantes.Vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de travailler avec une équipe à distance ; vous appréciez de collaborer sur des problèmes, de poser des questions, de fournir un retour d'information et de soutenir les autres dans leurs objectifs.Expérience de l'utilisation d'une plateforme en nuage (nous utilisons AWS)Expérience dans le développement de pipelines ELT/ETL et de suivi d'événements--------
5+ years of experience as a data engineer or equivalent as a software engineerExperience with technical mentoring, coaching, and improving the technical output of the people around you.Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders.Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goalsExperience with a cloud platform (We use AWS)Experience developing ELT/ETL and event tracking pipelinesUne attention particulière est accordée aux candidats présentant les caractéristiques suivantes / Extra consideration for candidates with the following: 
Expérience avec Python, SQL, Snowflake, Snowplow, Airflow, dbt, Singer taps, Fivetran, terraform, CircleCI, fastapiExpérience des aspects internes d'un moteur de calcul distribué (Spark, Presto, DBT ou Flink/Beam)Expérience de l'optimisation des requêtes, de l'allocation et de la gestion des ressources, et de la performance des lacs de données (Presto, SQL).Expérience de l'infrastructure cloud (Kubernetes, Terraform, etc.)Expérience des produits et méthodes de sécurité (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos, etc.)Expérience du déploiement et de la mise à l'échelle de solutions de ML à l'aide de frameworks open-source (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)Expérience dans la construction d'applications full-stack (Node.js, React, TypeScript)--------
Experience with Python, SQL, Snowflake, Snowplow, Airflow, dbt, Singer taps, Fivetran, terraform, CircleCI, fastapiExperience with the internals of a distributed compute engine (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)Experience in query optimization, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)Experience with cloud infrastructure (Kubernetes, Terraform, etc.)Experience with security products and methods (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos, etc.)Experience deploying and scaling ML solutions using open-source frameworks (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)Experience building full-stack applications (Node.js, React, TypeScript)
Qui Sommes-nous / About Us

Notre mission est de faciliter la vie des ouvriers dans le monde entier en créant des logiciels qui répondent à leurs besoins et à leurs réalités. Notre produit change véritablement la vie de 80% de la population active qui ne travaille pas derrière un bureau et qui a besoin d'un logiciel d'entreprise à portée de main.

MaintainX s'engage à créer un environnement diversifié. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans considération de race, de couleur, de religion, de sexe, d'identité ou d'expression de genre, d'orientation sexuelle, d'origine nationale, de génétique, d'invalidité, d'âge ou de statut d'ancien combattant.

Our mission is to make the life of blue-collar workers easier worldwide by creating software that meets their needs and realities. Our product is truly life-changing for 80% of the workforce that doesn’t work behind a desk and needs enterprise-grade software at their fingertips.

MaintainX is committed to creating a diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

description.text:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com
 

Department Overview
TD Securities (TDS) is one of the world's leading wholesale banks with operations spread across 15 offices globally. It provides a full suite of products and services to corporate and institutional clients through Global Markets (GM), Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB), and Global Transaction Banking (GTB) that collaborate to provide high quality integrated financial solutions. Global Operations and Business Services employees are unique individuals whose varied talents and experiences bring value to the way they deliver for the franchise. Whether you are analytical or creative, business savvy or a people person, Global Operations and Business Services provides an ideal opportunity to succeed. 
Payment Innovation and Projects Delivery team in Global Operations and Business Services unit, is responsible for developing and maintaining the near-term strategy and execution roadmaps for Payments, with a focus on initiatives that create business value while continuing to build towards our Payments Platform target state vision. With an enterprise-wide focus, the team is charged with ownership of the Payments Platform and associated capabilities that can be leveraged across global multiple lines of business, products, and features. 
 

Job Description
We are looking for a team member who thrives in the rapid pace of change that makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think and execute strategic change initiatives in TD Securities (TDS), TD Bank Group, Global Operations and Business Services. 
Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you would be asked to perform:  Contributes to a culture of innovation, actively seeking ways to enhance the capability and performance efficiency, efficacy, and success of TD Securities Work with Global Operations process owners and business segments' stakeholders to ensure effective communication, integration of project issues and deliverables, and  clear articulation of business requirements are captured Use negotiation and influencing skills to build consensus amongst diverse stakeholder groups to ensure project deliverables are met Document Business or Stakeholder Requirements in Agile format User Stories that can be understood by the intended solution developers. Develop high level and detailed requirements by researching/analyzing issues, identifying opportunities for process optimization. Work with functional team to produce detailed functional specifications. Work with end users and other Business Analysts to analyze, recommend solutions to problems Document detailed test cases with data input and output to be consumed by Quality Engineer team to develop E2E testing automation to meet established expected acceptance criteria Participate in the exception manual testing, where applicable Ensure deliverables meet business and end-user requirement and assist in implementation business validation Create training artefacts and provide support in delivering training sessions to Operations teams or business users Manages resolution of issues and risks effectively and if required ensures timely escalation of the issues and risks Communicates effectively at scrum sessions to resolve issues and challenges on a timely manner to meet project timeline. 

 

Job Requirements
Strong communication and relationship skills 

Proven collaborative and partnering skills Excellent customer service skills Good track record of identifying and delivering process optimization Strong ability to execute in all situations and adjust quickly when necessary Creative and strategic thinker 

Good organizational skills, with the abilities to manage multiple deliverables in a time- sensitive environment and adapt to frequently changing priorities. Ability to work effectively within a team, as well as independently. Good relationship management skills with demonstrated inter-personal skills, conflict resolution, and negotiating skills Experienced in Agile project techniques and tools including Microsoft Project, JIRA and Confluence Experience in testing and the concept of E2E testing automation framework. Understanding of development, data manipulation would enhance the partnership with Quality Engineering team to build robust repeatable tests harness Having Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) certification or experience operating in scaled agile delivery is considered an asset Good presentation skills, with an ability to work effectively with several partners Knowledge of Swift, life cycle of wire payment and Global Transaction Banking services is an asset 

Familiarity with Swift ISO 20022 standards is an asset 

 

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

companyDescription.text:
The Sonatype journey started 15 years ago, just as the concept of “open source” software development was gaining steam. From our humble beginning as core contributors to Apache Maven, to supporting the world’s largest repository of open source components (Central), to distributing the world's most popular repository manager (Sonatype Nexus Repository), we’ve played a meaningful role in helping the world embrace the power of open innovation.

Over time, we witnessed the staggering volume and variety of open source libraries that began flowing into every development environment in the world. We understood that when open source components are properly managed, they provide a tremendous energy for accelerating innovation. Conversely, when unmanaged, open source "gone wild" can lead directly to security vulnerabilities, licensing risks, enormous rework, and waste.

Our vision today is simple.

We are laser focused on helping organizations continuously harness all of the good that open source has to offer, without any of the risk. In order to do this, we have invested in knowing more about the quality of open source than anyone else in the world. This investment takes the form of machine learning, artificial intelligence, and human expertise, which in aggregate produces highly curated intelligence that is infused into every Sonatype product. Organizations equipped with Sonatype products make better decisions, innovate faster at scale, and rest comfortably knowing that their applications always consist of the highest quality open source components.

description.text:
Sonatype is the software supply chain management company. We're on a mission to change how the world innovates by making software development easier. From running the world's largest repository of Java open-source components (Maven Central) to inventing componentized software development and then software supply chain management to creating the only solution that stops malicious open-source malware in its tracks, we're constantly leading the industry while helping thousands of customers manage open source every day.
Already used by 15 million developers, we have lofty goals for our technology to be in the hands of every engineering team. And we need you to do that. Join us !
Learn more at www.sonatype.com .
We are looking for team members that want to help us change the way the world innovates through software. The Sonatype team has already done this through its contributions to the Maven build system, the Nexus Repository Manager and Nexus Lifecycle, and most recently with Sonatype Developer and the Sonatype Platform – literally changing the way the world creates and delivers software across thousands of organizations and millions of developers.
That was just the beginning. We need your help so that we can do it again. If you are interested in delivering value across nearly every decision made in the world of software development, to help companies create better and safer software faster, to transform innovation through software, read on.
Who We Are And What You'll Do
You have foundational knowledge in software engineering and would like to expand your skill set in quality, testing, debugging, design and security of it.You are motivated by the opportunity to contribute to improving the Software Supply Chain and Static Application Security Testing. You will be a member of the Sonatype Developer SAST Team.You will be responsible for the back-end processing that supports the static analysis capability and work with the teams supporting that software to incorporate changes needed to trigger static analysis, monitor the progress of static analysis, and retrieve results. This may involve building new command line utilities, new services, and APIs.You will collaborate not only with your primary team on projects but with other Sonatype product teams as well.
What Skills You'll Need
2-5 years of experience with Kotlin, Java and Java frameworks.Experience or familiarity with React JS.Working knowledge of contemporary DevOps pipelines. Knowledge of multiple programming languages, especially more niche / emerging languages such as Rust, Kotlin, Haskell, OCaml, Clojure, Scheme, Lisp, Datalog, or PrologKnowledge of graph databases (Neo4j, JGraphT)Experience writing compilers or interpreters. Professional experience is preferred but course projects would also be qualifying.Experience using static analysis tools. Especially experience using these tools in a large enterprise environment.You can demonstrate an understanding of how software is built and delivered.Understand version control and continuous integration.Passionate about lifelong learning and willing to tinker in different product technology stacks and/or languages.
At Sonatype, we value diversity and inclusivity. We offer perks such as parental leave, diversity and inclusion working groups, and flexible working practices to allow our employees to show up as their whole selves. We are an equal-opportunity employer, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.
